subclusters.warning_reason: 2 subclusters too small, 2 theories not assigned

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS/RNS as signaling molecules and redox tone regulation affecting aging, emphasizing balanced redox signaling rather than damage alone.
Describes ROS as physiological regulators modulating specific protein cysteine oxidation and pathways linked to aging, fitting redox signaling mechanisms.
Focuses on redox signaling dysfunction in muscle aging via ROS and peroxiredoxins, highlighting redox signaling impairment rather than damage.
Links redox signaling via ROS to autophagy, inflammation, and senescence, emphasizing dynamic redox regulation of aging processes.
Describes dual role of ROS in signaling and protein aggregation, focusing on redox-regulated reversible protein aggregation as a stress response.
Emphasizes redox state as a regulator of cellular function and signaling disruption as cause of aging, highlighting redox signaling over damage.
Focuses on disruption of thiol redox circuits and nonradical oxidants affecting redox signaling networks, fitting redox signaling and control.
Proposes aging driven by pro-oxidizing shift disrupting redox-regulated signaling, emphasizing redox signaling dysfunction.
Focuses on redox homeostasis and signaling in brain aging, linking redox imbalance to neurodegeneration via signaling pathways.
Describes redox homeostasis dysfunction involving H2S signaling and nutrient regulation, emphasizing systemic redox balance and signaling.
Links disruption of redox-regulated hormesis to aging and degenerative diseases, focusing on redox signaling and adaptive stress responses.
Focuses on NRF2 promoter methylation as an epigenetic marker linking redox regulation to aging, emphasizing epigenetic control of redox defenses.
Describes dietary restriction and methionine restriction modulating redox homeostasis via H2S and Nrf2 activation, linking diet to redox aging mechanisms.
Shows how dietary thiol antioxidants disrupt physiological ROS signaling, accelerating aging, highlighting diet-induced redox signaling modulation.
Proposes 2-mercaptoethanol modulates redox balance and sulfhydryl maintenance, acting as dietary redox modulator affecting aging and immune function.
Focuses on caloric restriction reducing oxidative stress and pro-oxidizing shifts, linking energy intake and diet to redox regulation of aging.
Emphasizes NADPH and G6PD in antioxidant defense and redox homeostasis, linking metabolic enzyme regulation to redox aging mechanisms.
Describes compartmentalized redox chemistry and metabolic signaling policing cell-level variation, linking metabolism and redox regulation to aging.
Proposes circadian regulation of redox, bioenergetics, and temperature via mitochondrial-nuclear interactions, linking metabolic redox cycles to aging.
Describes TBP-2 regulation of thioredoxin affecting redox state, energy metabolism, and cellular senescence, linking redox and metabolic aging pathways.
Focuses on thioredoxin isoforms' roles in redox regulation, lifespan, and cancer, highlighting thioredoxin system's complex impact on aging.
Emphasizes thioredoxin as cytoprotective antioxidant regulating redox signaling, apoptosis, and lifespan extension.
Describes evolutionarily conserved thioredoxin system roles in antioxidant defense and lifespan modulation across species.
Shows Trx1 overexpression effects on oxidative stress, lifespan, and cancer development, illustrating thioredoxin's dual role.
Highlights dual and compartment-specific effects of thioredoxin isoforms on aging, cancer, and inflammation.
Focuses on superoxide as a redox signaling molecule modulating longevity via ARGK-1 and insulin/IGF-1 pathways.
